alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 25 at 12:42PM CDT until October 29 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Black River at Black River Falls affecting Jackson County. .Heavy rain in excess of 4 to 5 inches fell across the Black River basin Tuesday night, resulting in the river reaching major flood stage this afternoon. Additional rainfall amounts tonight around 0.5 to 1 inch will hold the river in flood stage longer, slowly falling below flood stage this weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Black River at Black River Falls. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 55.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 43.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM CDT Wednesday was 55.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 57.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 47.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 55.9 feet on 08/28/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CDT.
